nodes.title: II.2. Superficial structures: Primarily funerary superstructure
Funerary Structure FS2
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS2 (3.5 m x 2.7 m) is a rectangular structure that appears to be aligned in the cardinal directions (29.797΄ / 14.027΄). FS2 was established on a narrow bench and is entirely covered in loose stones.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS3
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS3 (6.7 m x 7 m) is situated 12.7 m upslope of FS2 (29.795΄ / 14.015΄). This ovoid or sub-rectangular structure with an open interior was built into a fairly steep slope. Stones are piled up to a height of 90 cm on its south/forward flank. The slippage of the slope has obliterated much of the upper portion of the structure.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS4
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS4 (6.6 m x 4.8 m) is situated 1 m north of FS3. This ovoid structure has the same setting as FS3 and was built into a fairly steep slope. Its highly degraded perimeter walls enclose an open interior.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS5
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS5 (4.5 m x 4.8 m) is situated 1 m north of FS4 and was also built into a fairly steep slope. The perimeter walls of this ovoid enclosure are in an advanced state of disintegration.
